main event: On 7 November 1957, a saucer-shaped object the size of a basketball was observed at great altitude in Towner, North Dakota. It emitted a very bright light and was seen high in the southwest sky.
interesting points: The sighting was classified as a ground-visual observation with no specified length of time.
At first, the object appeared reddish, then changed to red and blue later.
The object was observed moving from the southwest to the west and decreasing in altitude.
The observation took place at night and was witnessed by a cattle trucker and a gas station operator.
The observation was deemed to have definitely sufficient data for evaluation, and the conclusion was that it remained unidentified.
sighted object: saucer-shaped object the size of a basketball emitting a very bright light
